intro: Metastelma abietoides, commonly known as the fir-leaf metaphytes, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are elongated and needle-like, resembling those of fir trees, and it produces small, white to greenish flowers. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
